name: A La Locanda di Orsaria

reviews.text: This is indeed perfect for quick access to the train station, and the air conditioning really worked!! It has been recently decorated, and had all the necessary requirements. The rooms are tiny, but very clean and furnished well. The bath is en suite, and again tiny, but with everything we needed. The staff was friendly and efficient. Unfortunately, though breakfast was included in our rate, we were unable to benefit from it. We had an early train, and staff were not accomodating to even arrange a quick croissant for the road. Also, there is no lift and all rooms are accessed by narrow, steep stairs. Something to consider if you expect to have lots of luggage. Compared to other Venice hotel rates, and considering the local, this is a nice find.
reviews.title: Perfect for our stay

likes.disliked: — not accomodating re: breakfast and early train schedules

reviews.text: To all of the staff at Locanda Di Orsaria, especially "Sara" Thanks so much for wonderful stay and experience while in Venice. My family and I had a wonderful time and would certainly recommend your place to anyone who travels to Venice.
reviews.title: Great Location and Great place to stay. Staff is Outstanding

likes.disliked: — July was very hot, but no reflection on the Hotel.

reviews.text: After spending a number of days in Rome one cannot depend on the Star rating of hotels but we were most pleased with the room, location and especially the service and attention we received. There is a great number of choices to stay with wide ranges of price, but would most certainly return.
reviews.title: A Little Gem

likes.disliked: — no bar or tea facility in room

reviews.title: Loved it loved it loved it!
Wonderful stay in Venice - great location!

reviews.text: The Orsaria was actually in a great location. It is literally right around the corner from the train station, which was extremely convenient for late night arrivals or departures. Come out of the train station and go to your left. La Locanda di Orsaria is located on the very first Alley to your left. There is a sign on the alley entrance that says Hotel Orsaria with a sign pointing to the left.
reviews.title: Great location / Good Service / Okay Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Some people might want to stay in the more central parts of Venice to be close to St. Marks etc, however this location really can't be beat. In addition to being next to the train station, it is right at a vaperetto stop as well. The vaperettos that stop at this location literally can take you all over Venice as well as to Murano and Burano very easily. Get a vaperetto guide at the ticket booths b/c some vaperettos make multiple stops while others only make a few stops. Spending the few extra minutes to figure this out can make the difference between a 10 minute or a 20 minute ride.
reviews.title: You'll love this gem!!

likes.disliked: — No lift thusThe three flight of stairs.

reviews.text: Thanks to the hotel (front desk), we took a free water taxi to the island of Murano to see a glass blowing factory. They were working in conjunction with a local glass company and we got to watch an amazing 20 minute display by some master artesians as they put together multiple pieces of glassware. I highly recommend this side trip, and there was no purchase or other commitment required.
reviews.title: Convenient hotel near train station
Great Hotel by Train Station
reviews.text: Visiting St. Marks Square & Basilica, and the Palazzo Ducale was a fun afternoon. If you visit the Palazzo Ducale, be sure to take in the tour of the old prison/dungeon. Very cool.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We did take a gondola ride, and were referenced to a specific stop near the Hotel Bauer. This was a quieter area (not to far from St. Marks) with little wait. Don't be fooled by the gondoliers - they are regulated to charge only 80 Euro for up to 6 people for a 40 minute ride. Our hotel clerk gave us a booklet that stated this to show the gondoliers and sure enough it came in useful. They tried to charge us 100 Euro, we showed them the book, and they charged us 80.
reviews.title: Fantastic Little hotel

reviews.text: I found this hotel through Trip Advisor and all of the previous reviews convinced me that this place was the one for us. We were looking for a hotel close to the train station (literally a 2 minute walk without getting lost) that could accomodate 4 people in a room. Here's how our stay went: We turned left outside the station, continued on past the bridge and we turned down the second "calle" (alleyway). On the wall to the right was written a number of hotel names and when we saw "Locanda" we knew we were on the right street. We went down a bit and it's on the right hand side. Reception staff was really warm, all of them spoke English well. Our room was absolutely gorgeous, really large and exactly what was pictured on their website. Beautiful murano glass chandelier and sconces on the wall by the bedsides. The bathroom is beautiful and the water pressure is really good. This hotel has thought of everything to make your stay wonderful. The beds are really, really comfortable too. It was so tastefully decorated and the antique dresser/desk was such a nice addition to the room. When we opened our window in the morning it was music to our ears to hear the sound of footsteps echoing in the alleyway and to hear people talking...truly Italian. We even had a pigeon land on the windowsill and look in. We really hoped it wouldn't fly in though. The breakfast is to die for!!! The attention that is given to you at breakfast is absolutely wonderful. The food is terrific and you'll find terrific food all over Venice too. We were pretty sad to leave because we were only there for 2 nights but next time we come we'll stay longer, stay in the same room. We had to leave early in the morning and the front staff suggested that we pay our bill the previous night so as to save time in the morning and we did and it worked out great for us. We didn't have to take any waterbuses or taxis to get around and it was great not to have to lug our suitcases all through Venice looking for our hotel. Beware that when you take a vaporetto or taxi to your hotel that you are not only paying to get onto it but you also have to pay 6 euros for each piece of luggage that you have. One more reason for staying close to the station. This is a real gem in Venice and I would wholeheartedly recommend this hotel. You won't be disappointed.
reviews.title: Fantastic hotel!!!

likes.liked: — Large room, beautiful bathroom, beautifully furnished
likes.disliked: — I found no fault with the room at all

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have just come back from a couple of nights at this hotel and loved it! It was very quaint and had lovely rooms and a nice big clean bathroom. The location could not have been better as we were a stone throw from the train station and near to a busy vaparetto stop. It was lovely to walk from the hotel into St Marks through the lovely streets then get the vaparetto back or vice versa. The hotel had some nice little restaurants and shops nearby. The breakfasts at the hotel were a good start to the day and the staff at the hotel were genuinely friendly and helpful.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!!!!!

likes.disliked: — The bell that rang outside for two mins at 5am.....not a problem really!

reviews.text: I had a great holiday although Venice can be quite pricey and has many tourist traps I also left my camera on the train when I got back to Milan, which was a disappointing end to a good holiday.
reviews.title: Have already recommended this hotel to friends
Locanda di Orsaria
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed here for 7 nights - we wanted somewhere near to the rail station as we intended to visit other places outside Venice by train. We also wanted somewhere that was friendly and not too large and impersonal.

The staff could not have been more helpful (Pietro is a gem and makes wonderful coffee). The breakfasts set us up for the day. A lunchtime panini only needed as a booster before a visit to a restaurant at night plus (of course) copious ice creams.
reviews.title: Love It!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at the La Locanda Di Orsaria from August 7th to 12th 2007. We stayed in a superior double for 140 euros a night. It was a nice sized room, furnished very nicely and the bathroom was awesome. All done in marble and plenty of hot water. You can use the hand held shower or the rainfall shower
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

likes.liked: — The staff and cleanliness of the room

reviews.title: Excellent Location
reviews.text: head. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. You always receive a greeting when you are arriving or when you are going out for the day. The breakfast was adequate to get you by for the morning. The hot chocolate was to die for. The gentleman that did the majority of the serving was fluent in many languages and always remembered which language to greet you in each morning. The only down side with the hotel was there was no elevator. But after humping your luggage over three bridges to arrive at the hotel a few stairs were no problem. The young man that was working when we arrived offered to carry our bags to the room which i found very nice. That just shows the type of service you can expect at this fine boutique hotel. The rooms were absolutley spotless. It is also nicely located for exploring Venice. Numerous restaurants close by as well for dining. Varying selections of menus and costs. It is quite easy to find as well. If you arrive by bus from the airport. You are dropped off at the P. Roma. As you exit the bus you will see a short road that leads directly to the water. Once you reach the end of the road turn right. Follow the canal. You will cross two bridges that cross small canals feeding into the grand canal. Then you will reach

description: Cozy and complete with all modern comforts, the A La Locanda di Orsaria is proud to welcome you to the enchanting city of Venice, offering a friendly and comfortable environment just two minutes from the Santa Lucia train station and five from the Piazzale Roma car terminal.Stay at our comfortable 3-star hotel where you can enjoy famous down-home hospitality that will transform your Venice get-away into a wonderful and unforgettable vacation.Two minutes from the train station and Lista di Spagna, main street between Rialto and St. Mark's Square, the inviting rooms at the A La Locanda di Orsaria - all non-smoking - bask in silence of a quiet and secluded calle, ideal for guests seeking peace and quiet after an exciting day in Venice. All the rooms are elegantly furnished and complete with all the modern comforts. Superior category rooms are stylishly decorated with eighteenth century Venetian style furniture and wallpaper.
